author: Rebecca Ballhaus
title: Hope Hicks, Trump’s Communications Director, to Resign
text:
WASHINGTON—Hope Hicks, White House communications director, said Wednesday she is resigning, marking the departure of a presidential confidante and longtime lieutenant from the West Wing.

Ms. Hicks has been one of President Donald Trump’s longest-serving aides, handling most of the communications responsibilities for his 2016 election campaign before joining him as director of strategic communications. In September, she was tapped to serve as communications director, becoming the fourth person to hold that role in the administration’s... Here’s a recap of the whirlwind year in Washington. Photo Illustration: Heather Seidel/The Wall Street Journal
